page.title: 20Leeds/Liverpool Canal,Aire R
page.content:
The canal that runs past our school is called the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. They started the canal 1n 1770 and finished in 1816. In the canal are tadpoles, leeches, watersnails and little fish. The plants beside the canal are many different kinds of weeds, Canadian pondweed, water crowfoot and water moss, and reeds amd grass. Most of the people who use the canal are tourists. The River Aire (on the other side of our school) goes from Gordale to Keighley then goes two ways, to Oxenhope and Bradford. The name comes from early beck. The River Aire is polluted because of the sewage.
Rivers are natural, but canals are man-made.
